practices.name: AC.L1-3.1.1 – AUTHORIZED ACCESS CONTROL
practices.brief_description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices.

assessment_objectives.text: authorized users are identified
processes acting on behalf of authorized users are identified
devices authorized to connect to the system are identified
system access is limited to authorized users
system access is limited to processes acting on behalf of authorized users
system access is limited to authorized devices

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: access control policy, account lists, audit logs; Interview: account managers, admins; Test: account management processes.
practices.discussion: Access control policies, account management, and enforcement mechanisms limit access between users/processes and objects. (See PDF Level 1 guide.)
practices.further_discussion: Maintain lists of authorized users, processes, and devices; approve account requests before granting access; limit devices like printers; coordinate with IA practices.

practices.name: AC.L1-3.1.2 – TRANSACTION & FUNCTION CONTROL
practices.brief_description: Limit system access to the types of transactions and functions authorized users are permitted to execute.

assessment_objectives.text: types of transactions and functions for users are defined
system access is limited to defined transactions/functions

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: access control lists/policies; Interview: administrators; Test: enforcement mechanisms.
practices.discussion: Define role-based privileges and restrict functions (create/read/update/delete) to necessary roles.
practices.further_discussion: Consider time-of-day, point-of-origin, and account types when defining privileges.

practices.name: AC.L1-3.1.20 – EXTERNAL CONNECTIONS
practices.brief_description: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.

assessment_objectives.text: connections to external systems are identified
use of external systems is identified
connections are verified
use of external systems is verified
connections are controlled/limited
use of external systems is controlled/limited

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: connection inventories, contracts; Interview: system owners; Test: connection controls.
practices.discussion: Control connections to personal devices, partner systems, and cloud services; use firewalls and access controls.
practices.further_discussion: Establish terms for external systems; restrict access from unmanaged devices.

practices.name: AC.L1-3.1.22 – CONTROL PUBLIC INFORMATION
practices.brief_description: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible systems to avoid posting FCI.

assessment_objectives.text: authorized individuals to post/process public info are identified
procedures ensure FCI is not posted publicly
a review process exists prior to posting
public content reviewed to ensure no FCI
mechanisms to remove improper posting exist

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: posting approval records, training; Interview: content managers; Test: removal procedures.
practices.discussion: Define an approval chain and review processes for public content to prevent inadvertent disclosure of FCI.
practices.further_discussion: Assign only designated staff to post publicly and maintain review logs.

practices.name: IA.L1-3.5.1 – IDENTIFICATION
practices.brief_description: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.

assessment_objectives.text: system users are identified
processes acting on behalf of users are identified
devices accessing the system are identified

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: ID policy, system account lists, audit logs; Interview: ops/admins; Test: identification mechanisms.
practices.discussion: Assign unique identifiers (usernames) to users and identify devices by MAC/IP/certificates where necessary.
practices.further_discussion: Unique identifiers help with accountability and supporting AC practices.

practices.name: IA.L1-3.5.2 – AUTHENTICATION
practices.brief_description: Authenticate (verify) identities of users, processes, and devices before granting access.

assessment_objectives.text: user identities are authenticated before access
process identities authenticated before access
device identities authenticated before access

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: authenticator records, policies; Interview: admins; Test: authenticator mechanisms.
practices.discussion: Use strong authenticators (passwords, tokens, certs) and avoid factory defaults; manage authenticators lifecycle.
practices.further_discussion: Consider token lifetimes, password rules, and revocation for temporary authenticators.

practices.name: MP.L1-3.8.3 – MEDIA DISPOSAL
practices.brief_description: Sanitize or destroy system media containing Federal Contract Information before disposal or reuse.

assessment_objectives.text: media containing FCI is sanitized or destroyed before disposal
media containing FCI is sanitized before reuse

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: media sanitization policy, sanitization records; Interview: custodians; Test: sanitization procedures.
practices.discussion: Sanitization methods include clearing, purging, cryptographic erase, and destruction; for paper use shredding or secure destruction.
practices.further_discussion: Follow NIST SP 800-88 guidance when selecting sanitization techniques.

practices.name: PE.L1-3.10.1 – LIMIT PHYSICAL ACCESS
practices.brief_description: Limit physical access to information systems, equipment, and operating environments to authorized individuals.

assessment_objectives.text: authorized individuals allowed physical access are identified
physical access to systems is limited to authorized individuals
physical access to equipment is limited to authorized individuals
physical access to operating environments is limited to authorized individuals

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: access lists, policies; Interview: facility managers; Test: access controls like badges/locks.
practices.discussion: Use locks, badge readers, and lists to limit access; designate sensitive areas.
practices.further_discussion: Place output devices to avoid exposure and maintain access records per retention policy.

practices.name: PE.L1-3.10.3 – ESCORT VISITORS
practices.brief_description: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity in areas with physical access to organizational systems.

assessment_objectives.text: visitors are escorted
visitor activity is monitored

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: visitor logs, escort procedures; Interview: reception/facilities staff; Test: escort enforcement.
practices.discussion: Require visitor badges and escorts in sensitive areas; monitor via cameras or logs.
practices.further_discussion: Ensure visitor sign-in/out records are retained as required.

practices.name: PE.L1-3.10.4 – PHYSICAL ACCESS LOGS
practices.brief_description: Maintain audit logs of physical access.

assessment_objectives.text: physical access audit logs are maintained

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: physical access logs, retention records; Interview: security staff; Test: record retrieval.
practices.discussion: Logs may be procedural or automated; retain per organizational policy.
practices.further_discussion: Use badge readers or sign-in logs and store in secure location.

practices.name: PE.L1-3.10.5 – MANAGE PHYSICAL ACCESS
practices.brief_description: Control and manage physical access devices (keys, badges, locks).

assessment_objectives.text: physical access devices are identified
physical access devices are controlled
physical access devices are managed

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: inventories, change logs; Interview: facilities; Test: revocation procedures.
practices.discussion: Inventory keys/badges, revoke access on role change, and maintain records.
practices.further_discussion: Document device assignments and update badge system as personnel change.

practices.name: SC.L1-3.13.1 – BOUNDARY PROTECTION
practices.brief_description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at external boundaries and key internal boundaries.

assessment_objectives.text: external system boundary is defined
key internal boundaries are defined
communications are monitored at external boundary
communications are monitored at key internal boundaries
communications are controlled at external boundary
communications are controlled at key internal boundaries
communications are protected at external boundary
communications are protected at key internal boundaries

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: network diagrams, firewall configs, logs; Interview: network admins; Test: monitoring and control mechanisms.
practices.discussion: Protect boundaries with firewalls, proxies, and monitoring; log and review traffic for anomalies.
practices.further_discussion: Define DMZs and use segmentation to isolate public systems from internal systems.

practices.name: SC.L1-3.13.5 – PUBLIC-ACCESS SYSTEM SEPARATION
practices.brief_description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components separated from internal networks.

assessment_objectives.text: publicly accessible components are identified
subnetworks for public components are separated

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: network segmentation docs, DMZ configs; Interview: network admins; Test: isolation mechanisms.
practices.discussion: Use DMZs/VLANs or separated cloud environments to keep public systems isolated.
practices.further_discussion: Block default traffic and allow only authorized flows between DMZ and internal networks.

practices.name: SI.L1-3.14.1 – FLAW REMEDIATION
practices.brief_description: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner.

assessment_objectives.text: time to identify system flaws is specified
system flaws are identified within the specified time

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: vulnerability records, patch logs; Interview: IT/security; Test: scanning and remediation processes.
practices.discussion: Track vulnerabilities and schedule remediation within defined timeframes.
practices.further_discussion: Use scans, change control, and configuration management to reduce risk of unresolved flaws.

practices.name: SI.L1-3.14.2 – MALICIOUS CODE PROTECTION
practices.brief_description: Employ malicious code protection mechanisms to detect and protect against malware.

assessment_objectives.text: malicious code protection is deployed to relevant components
malicious code detection and handling processes exist

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: anti-malware configs, scan logs; Interview: admins; Test: scanning and quarantine processes.
practices.discussion: Use anti-malware (real-time and scheduled scans) and quarantine suspicious files.
practices.further_discussion: Consider reputation-based and signature mechanisms and update definitions regularly.

practices.name: SI.L1-3.14.4 – UPDATE MALICIOUS CODE PROTECTION
practices.brief_description: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.

assessment_objectives.text: malicious code protection mechanisms are updated when new releases are available

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: update logs, policies; Interview: administrators; Test: update automation.
practices.discussion: Automate or schedule frequent updates to keep malware detection current.
practices.further_discussion: Track update frequency and test post-update behavior.

practices.name: SI.L1-3.14.5 – SYSTEM & FILE SCANNING
practices.brief_description: Perform system and file scanning for malicious code and vulnerabilities.

assessment_objectives.text: system and file scanning is performed and results reviewed

practices.potential_assessment_methods_and_objects: Examine: scan reports; Interview: admins; Test: scanning tools and remediation actions.
practices.discussion: Include endpoints, servers, email gateways and removable media in scanning policies.
practices.further_discussion: Document scanning frequency and response actions for detected issues.

notes: Data summarized from CMMC Level 1 Self-Assessment Guide (uploaded PDF). See source for full descriptions and examples.
